magic_numbers.$2_per_day: Affordable daily habit, compares favorably to coffee

time_savings.quantification: Saves 10-15 min/day vs preparing nutrient-dense meal

high_willingness_indicators.patient_care_motivation: I need to be at my best to take care of others

subscription_appeal.cons: Subscription fatigue, fear of accumulating unused product
subscription_appeal.pros: Autopilot convenience, don't have to remember to reorder

energy_productivity.baseline: Brain fog, mid-shift crashes, need multiple coffees

too_expensive.reframe: Compare to daily coffee or eating out - similar cost, greater health impact

high_willingness_moments.new_years_resolution: January health goals, willing to invest

price_perception.free_trial_importance: Medium - prefer data over free trials

discount_sensitivity.optimal_strategy: Emphasize value and results over discounts

budget_context.past_wasted: $1500-3000+ over 3-5 years on failed supplement experiments
budget_context.household_income: $75k-150k - can afford premium but VERY resistant to wasting money
budget_context.mental_accounting: Supplements are in 'health investment' bucket, but skepticism is HIGH after repeated failures. Each new purchase feels like throwing good money after bad.
budget_context.competing_priorities: High-quality whole foods, gym membership, health tests (blood panels, microbiome), fitness equipment

price_signals.too_cheap: Under $40/month seems suspicious - what corners are being cut?
price_signals.sweet_spot: $60-90/month suggests serious product without exploitative markup
price_signals.justification_needed: Any price over $70/month needs clear explanation of why vs alternatives

price_perception.premium_tolerance: Willing to pay 50-100% more than AG1 IF bioavailability proof is compelling
comparison_anchors: Quality multivitamin stack at $40-60/month ('complex but somewhat trusted')
Whole food grocery premium: $100-200/month extra for organic ('real ROI')
price_perception.price_quality_belief: Price is NOT correlated with quality in supplements. Expensive products have disappointed just as much as cheap ones. Trust data, not price.

value_anchors: Cost per bioavailable nutrient (not cost per serving)
Money saved by replacing current supplement stack
Time saved not researching/buying/managing multiple bottles
Peace of mind from third-party testing
Risk mitigation: 'What's the cost of NOT fixing my deficiencies?'
Comparison to wasted money on failed supplements in past
willingness_to_pay_signals: 'Show me absorption studies vs powder' - will pay premium for proven bioavailability
'If it actually works, price doesn't matter' - frustrated by ineffective cheap options
'I'd pay more for transparent sourcing' - trust is worth premium
'Money-back guarantee makes me willing to try higher price' - risk removal unlocks budget
'Cost per day vs coffee' - willing to pay $3-4/day for real health impact
'What's included in that price?' - suspicious of hidden costs, wants all-in pricing

payment_psychology.commitment_fear: Annual plans are deal-breakers until product is proven - been burned by prepaying before
payment_psychology.preferred_model: Monthly subscription with easy cancellation (trust issue)
payment_psychology.payment_friction: Want to trial 1 month before committing, ideally at reduced risk
psychological_triggers: 'Try for 30 days, full refund if not satisfied' - removes risk
'Cancel anytime, no questions asked' - respects their skepticism
'Pay as you go until you're convinced' - acknowledges trust deficit
'Same price monthly or annual' - no pressure tactics = more trust

roi_calculation.deal_breakers: Any ROI calculation based on testimonials vs data is rejected
roi_calculation.acceptable_payback: If it costs $80/month but replaces $60 in other supplements + saves 2 hours/month research, ROI is clear
how_they_calculate: Measurable outcomes: blood test improvements, energy levels, workout recovery
Time saved: fewer pills, less research, simplified routine
Money saved: replacing 4-6 supplements with one product
Waste avoided: not buying ineffective products anymore
Health cost avoidance: preventing future deficiency-related issues
roi_calculation.measurement_timeframe: Need to see results in 30-90 days or will churn

pricing_objections.objection: 'This is just as expensive as AG1'
pricing_objections.reframe_needed: Here's the bioavailability data showing why frozen ≠ powder. 60-day guarantee = try risk-free.
pricing_objections.underlying_fear: I'll waste another $300+ on overhyped product

pricing_objections.objection: 'I can get these nutrients from food for less'
pricing_objections.reframe_needed: You're right - IF you eat 12+ servings of diverse produce daily. This fills gaps, not replaces food.
pricing_objections.underlying_fear: Am I being sold something I don't need?

pricing_objections.objection: 'Why should I trust this won't disappoint like everything else?'
pricing_objections.reframe_needed: We publish third-party testing, cite bioavailability studies, and offer full refund. We're transparent about what we can't do.
Ships in insulated packaging, stores in regular freezer. Price includes all shipping costs.
pricing_objections.underlying_fear: Hidden costs in shipping, storage, special equipment

discount_sensitivity.credibility_impact: Flash sales and urgency tactics destroy trust with this segment
discount_sensitivity.preferred_approach: Consistent, fair pricing. Occasional 'try your first month at $X' for new customers ONLY.
discount_sensitivity.referral_psychology: Will share with friends IF product works, but won't be bribed with discount codes. Reputation matters more than $10 off.
discount_sensitivity.seasonal_sensitivity: Ignores Black Friday/New Year's supplement sales. Associates discounts with desperation.
discount_sensitivity.response_to_discounts: NEGATIVE - discounts trigger 'desperation marketing' alarm bells

expansion: Blood test shows improvement after 60 days
Positive independent reviews from trusted sources
contraction: Better alternative emerges with stronger evidence
budget_triggers.switching_costs: Will switch instantly if competitor shows better bioavailability data, regardless of price delta under $30/month

budget_triggers.opportunity: Health optimization as part of new year planning
Investing in next decade of health
Staying healthy to see them grow up

budget_context: Total health optimization budget: $500-1200/month (Whoop/Oura $30, gym $150, supplements $200-400, testing/labs $200-400). Income: $150k-350k (tech salaries). View health spending as investment in productivity and longevity. Willing to pay premium for quality but expect proportional value. Compare cost-per-day ($4-7/day for Greespi) vs coffee ($6/day) or lunch ($15). Annual thinking: $1,440-2,400/year needs to show measurable ROI.

price_perception.price_sensitivity: Low for proven interventions, extremely high for unproven ones. Will pay 3x more for 20% better results IF data supports it. Annoyed by pricing games (fake discounts). Prefer annual upfront with discount vs monthly.

value_anchors: $4-6 per day = less than a coffee, $120-180/month = less than eating out 3x, $1,500/year = fraction of health insurance deductible, Cost vs one ER visit for gut issues ($3,000+), Productivity gains: 10% energy boost = 4 extra productive hours/week = $8,000+/year value (at $200/hr), Compare to functional medicine doctor ($400/visit, multiple visits needed)
willingness_to_pay_signals: Paying for Whoop/Oura already (shows $30/mo commitment to tracking), Buying premium supplements from Nootropics Depot/Thorne ($100+/mo), Paying for microbiome testing ($200-400), Annual health optimization budget exists, Track ROI in spreadsheets (will pay for proven returns), Read pricing pages thoroughly (looking for transparency)
payment_psychology: Prefer annual payment with discount (better deal + set-it-forget-it), Want easy cancellation (no dark patterns), Expect prorated refunds if not working, Like milestone-based pricing (pay more if it works), Appreciate transparent pricing tiers, Suspicious of auto-renew tricks, Value company honesty about margins
roi_calculation: Primary: Energy/productivity metrics (Whoop recovery score, Oura readiness, subjective 1-10 daily rating). Secondary: Gut symptoms reduction (bloating, irregularity tracking), HRV improvement, Sleep quality metrics, Inflammation markers (if doing bloodwork). Tertiary: Long-term longevity investment (harder to quantify but matters). Formula: If 10% productivity boost = 4 hours/week × $200/hr = $800/week value. At $150/mo, ROI = 533% in first month. Need 90-day trial to validate.
pricing_objections: "How is this different from $20 spirulina on Amazon?" (Need heavy metal testing proof, bioavailability data), "Why frozen vs powder?" (Live organisms data, degradation studies), "$150/mo is a lot" (Cost per day reframe, ROI calculation, compare to alternatives), "Can I just eat algae?" (Concentration, consistency, safety testing), "Is this just another greens powder?" (Functional nutrition vs vitamin bomb, targeted gut health), "What if it doesn't work?" (Money-back guarantee with data submission)
discount_sensitivity: Low interest in % discounts (seems gimmicky). Interested in: volume discounts for 6-12 month commitment (saves decision fatigue), referral credits for friends (social proof + savings), early adopter pricing (reward for risk), loyalty tiers (data-based: show improvement = lower price), bundle with testing (Viome + Greespi package). Avoid: fake urgency ("24hr sale"), first-time discounts (devalues product), unclear original pricing.
budget_triggers: Positive: Published study showing results, trusted tech figure endorsement (with data), microbiome test results showing need, current solution failing (pain point), bonus/raise (windfall), health scare (gut issues flare), Q1 (new year optimization), tracking data shows plateau (need new intervention). Negative: Economic uncertainty (cancel discretionary), recent expensive health event (depleted budget), other supplement working well (no need to switch).

price_perception.price_sensitivity_level: Low for proven interventions with clear mechanisms

value_anchors.comparison_point: Cost of longevity interventions like NAD IVs

willingness_to_pay_signals.indicates: Doing due diligence, will pay if convinced

pricing_objections.objection: I can source individual compounds cheaper
pricing_objections.reframe_strategy: Highlight synergistic benefits and novel compounds not available individually

discount_sensitivity.optimal_strategy: Price on value of unique benefits, not discounts
